tasks.task: Participate in the development and implementation of Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) for rice production, focusing on sustainable resource management and safety.
subtasks: Collaborate with the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) to design pre- and post-harvest practices for safe and healthy rice products.
Align GAP approaches with international standards and guidelines, such as the International Compliance for Plant Protection.
Facilitate national accreditation for farmers who adhere to GAP practices, including the potential for premium pricing.
Advocate for the integration of GAP practices in export markets, particularly for countries like Vietnam and Thailand.
Address the evolving demands of domestic consumers, especially in cities, for safe and nutritious rice products.
Work with government entities, such as the Vietnamese provincial and national governments, to implement GAP practices in specific regions, like An Giang's Mekong Delta.
Apply natural resource management technologies to support sustainable practices in irrigated rice cultivation.
Promote the "five reductions one must do" initiative as part of the GAP implementation strategy.

tasks.task: A key task is participating in the development and implementation of Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) for rice production. This includes designing safe and healthy practices for the entire supply chain (pre- and post-harvest), ensuring safety and health at every stage. [MAINTASK]
subtasks: Work closely with the UN Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) to establish GAP standards. This involves international alignment and ensuring practices meet global safety and quality standards. [SUBTASK]
Implement sustainable resource management techniques, such as the "five reductions" approach (and "one must do"), to reduce environmental impact and ensure sustainability. [SUBTASK]

Help farmers obtain national accreditation through national and provincial committees. This also involves exploring premium pricing schemes for GAP-compliant products to incentivize adoption. [SUBTASK]
Focus on meeting international guidelines and compliance requirements for export markets, such as Europe, to maintain competitive edge and access premium markets. [SUBTASK]
Respond to growing consumer demands for safe, nutritious rice in urban areas, driving the need for GAP practices in both export and domestic markets. [SUBTASK]
Collaborate with governments, including provincial and national levels in Vietnam (e.g., An Giang province), to scale GAP practices through policy support and demonstration projects. [SUBTASK]
Integrate natural resource management technologies from research consortia (e.g., irrigated rice research) into farmer practices to enhance sustainability and efficiency. [SUBTASK]
